thread.title: Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble
thread.title_full: Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble

author: WILL GRAVES
title: Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble
text:
Gene J. Puskar Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble 
Pittsburgh Pirates first baseman Pedro Alvarez dives for a foul ball in the photo pit during the fifth inning of the National League wild card baseball game against the Chicago Cubs, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Pittsburgh. Alvarez was unable to make the catch. (AP Photo/Gene J. Puskar) Gene J.Puskar Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble 
Pittsburgh Pirates manager Clint Hurdle chews bubble gum as he walks through the dugout as his team trails the Chicago Cubs during the seventh inning of the National League wild card baseball game, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Pittsburgh. The Cubs won 4-0, and move on to play the St. Louis Cardinals in the NL Division Series. (AP Photo/Gene J.Puskar) Gene J. Puskar Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble 
Pittsburgh Pirates starting pitcher Gerrit Cole throws against the Chicago Cubs in the first inning of the National League wild card baseball game , Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, in Pittsburgh. (AP Photo/Gene J. Puskar) Posted: Thursday, October 8, 2015 9:37 am Pirates head into offseason after another October stumble Associated Press | 
PITTSBURGH (AP) — The man who symbolized the Pittsburgh Pirates' resurgence offered one final bit of advice before hopping onto his custom-made, Batman-inspired ride and zooming off into retirement. 
"Win the division," A.J. Burnett said in the quiet clubhouse Wednesday night after another postseason ended nine innings after it began. "No more wild-card junk."
